intro: Satyria dolichantha, commonly known as the long-stalked satyria, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and delicate foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
